thread.title: Sydney’s spring selling season sees some of the top trophy homes listed
thread.title_full: Sydney’s spring selling season sees some of the top trophy homes listed

author: Erin Forster Real estate reporter
title: Sydney’s spring selling season sees some of the top trophy homes listed
text:
SPRING has long been touted as the season to sell, and it has certainly got off to a strong start in Sydney with plenty of new listings across the board, but perhaps none the more eye-catching than those in the prestige category.
After suffering a quiet period following the GFC, 2015 has arguably seen the strongest comeback for this section of the market since.
Scores of homes have already achieved eight digit sale figures, including that of James Packer’s expansive Vaucluse pad, which just weeks ago smashed the record for most expensive residential property in Australian when it sold for $70 million.
Many agents are predicting the top end market will strengthen further, citing the falling Australian dollar as a key factor in attracting expat and Chinese buyers.
In the last few weeks alone, the market has been flooded with high end listings, with owners jumping on the chance to capitalise on the strengthened market to secure a premium for their residences.
For those keen to feast their eyes at what a trophy home with a seven or eight digit price tag looks like in Sydney, below is but some of the best prestige offerings currently available to buyers.
Bellevue Hill
The property, known as 'Leura,' located in Bellevue Hill is listed for more than $30 million. Source: Supplied
With an abundance of Federation charm, a top address and sweeping harbour views, it’s easy to see why it’s one of the top listings currently. Source: Supplied
With a price tag of more than $30 million, this Victoria Rd home is arguably the most lavish listing currently on the market. Built in 1891 on an impressive 4,260sq m block, ‘Leura’ is a grand eight-bedroom, eight-bathroom home that exudes an abundance of Federation charm while showcasing all the top end features that are expected of this calibre of property. But it’s the panorama views of Sydney Harbour, including the Harbour Bridge itself that really take your breath away.
Bellevue Hill
Further up Victoria Rd is this Spanish-mission style mansion that oozes Hollywood glamour. Source: Supplied
The expansive home features similar harbour vistas as it’s close neighbour plus an impressive ten bedrooms. Source: Supplied
Just a few houses down on Victoria Rd is ‘Alcooringa’ — a striking Spanish-mission style home that is equally extravagant, but in a ‘Hollywood glamour’ kind of way. Designed by acclaimed architect of the time F. Glynn Gilling; the 1930s heritage residence includes ten bedrooms, ten bathrooms, parking for nine cars, spectacular harbour vistas that can all be yours at a cost of more than $25 million.
Mosman
This striking Clifton Gardens home is set to give the 2015 Mosman suburb record a run for its money. Source: Supplied
Over six tonnes of copper was used in the construction of the four-bedroom home. Source: Supplied
One of the most expensive homes listed on the lower north shore is this Morella Rd home, which comes with a $15 million-plus asking price. If met, this would see it secure one of the highest sales results of the year on the lower north shore. Set within the heart of the suburb’s prestigious Clifton Gardens and occupying a prized position directly above Chowder Bay, this striking four-bedroom home is certainly worth its weight in gold, or rather copper, with over 6 tonnes of the bronzed metal incorporated into the home’s roof, downpipes, guttering and garage door.
Mosman
Also listed with $15 million-plus hopes is this Plunkett Rd home, set raised above Balmoral Beach. Source: Supplied
It’s striking appearance is the handiwork of renowned architect Alex Popov. Source: Supplied
Over the other side of Middle Head is this palatial Plunkett Rd home, which is also listed with a $15 million-plus asking price. Designed by acclaimed architect Alex Popov, the near-new four-bedroom house is set on a block that spans more than 1840sq m and is just one street back from Balmoral Beach, showcasing uninterrupted views over the reserve below and out across the beach towards North Head.
Northwood
Located in the small and exclusive suburb of Northwood, this $8 million-plus home offers both elegance and modern sophistication. Source: Supplied
Highlights include a tennis court, swimming pool and ample living space both inside and out. Source: Supplied
Northwood is one of Sydney’s smallest and most exclusive postcodes, with only about 250 houses. And given many of these offer incredible harbour views, it’s easy to see why owners rarely part from the homes here. Set across a 2,175sq m block on the corner of Northwood Rd, this character-rich residence offers an elegant unity of stately charm and contemporary luxury and includes six bedrooms, five bathrooms, a marble kitchen, mosaic tiled pool and spa, cabana and floodlit tennis court. It is billed to fetch over $8 million.
Seaforth
With a tennis court, swimming pool and putting green, this Seaforth home offers the ultimate in resort living. Source: Supplied
It’s raised vantage point affords it picturesque views across Middle Harbour. Source: Supplied
Set high on the ridge at Seaforth overlooking the pristine shores of Middle Harbour, this palatial five-bedroom home certainly lives up to its $8 million-plus price tag. Showcasing a distinct ‘resort-style’ lifestyle, it comes complete with a full size light lit tennis court, heated swimming pool surrounded by a large expanse of deck, a cabana and putting greens. And if this isn’t enough to evoke your holiday mode, the water views glimpsed from across the 2970sq m of grounds surely will.
Centennial Park
With its leafy yet incredibly central setting, its no surprise that more than $7 million is expected for this Centennial Park home. Source: Supplied
Originally built over 100 years ago, it maintains all of its heritage charm combined with modern luxuries. Source: Supplied
Centennial Park is one of few pockets of Sydney that offers the glorious balance of a quiet, leafy setting with the ultimate in convenience of location. Add a touch of history and a dash of luxury, and you have yourself one of the city’s most elegant top end residences. Located on Lang Rd, this 100 year-plus residence includes four bedrooms, Michael Cook designed gardens, a heated pool and guesthouse, all for more than $7 million.
Bellevue Hill
This modern masterpiece in the heart of prestigious Bellevue Hill is priced at more than $10 million. Source: Supplied
The stunning Marco Meneguzzi-designed interiors are a highlight of this Kambala Rd residence. Source: Supplied
A modern masterpiece in the heart of prestigious Bellevue Hill will always set you back a pretty penny. But if you’re after a home with exquisite Marco Meneguzzi-designed interiors that include a marble kitchen and open plan living that flows out to a terrace overlooking the pool; it’ll cost you more than $10 million. Set on almost 1,000sq m of grounds, this Kambala Road residence is a contemporary gem that offers stunning city skyline views at one of the suburb’s most prestigious addresses.
Pymble
Steeped in local history, this $9 million-plus manor will likely break the record for Telegraph Rd. Source: Supplied
It was built in 1901 for a founding member of Ku-ring-gai council. Source: Supplied
With price expectations of more than $9 million, this historic manor is set to break the record for Pymble’s most-prestigious street. Built in 1901 and originally christened ‘Wantage’, the six-bedroom, seven-bathroom Telegraph Rd home was designed for Alfred Herbert Howard Aldworth, an original member of the Ku-ring-gai Shire Council. It offers a superb blend of Federation charm with every modern convenience, including a full-sized, synthetic grass tennis court and a 13m swimming pool complete with a cabana.
Mosman
Set on the high side on what is fast becoming one of Mosman’s top streets is this Balmoral home with a price tag of more than $10 million. Source: Supplied
Perched on the high side of the road, it offers sweeping views across Balmoral Beach. Source: Supplied
With its quiet, leafy setting and spectacular views across Balmoral Beach, it’s easy to see why Plunkett Rd is fast becoming one of Mosman’s most prestigious addresses. With its northeast aspect, this magnificent five-bedroom home showcases a sweeping outlook that captures all three of Balmoral’s coastal bays below. Spread across three floors, the house has been built to the highest standards and is awash with exquisite finishes including in-built barbecue area, heated pool and a 2200 bottle temperature-controlled wine cellar. It is listed with $10 million-plus hopes.
Hunters Hill
With its own private jetty and boat shed, this Hunters Hill gem is the epitome of coastal luxury. Source: Supplied
The stylish interiors very much mirror the home’s surrounds. Source: Supplied
Positioned just metres back from the harbour’s sandy shores and with its own private boatshed and jetty perched above the water; this palatial home is the epitome of coastal luxury. The house is spread across 1,031sq m of beautifully manicured grounds on The Point Rd in Hunters Hill and includes four bedrooms, spacious living areas, a self-contained studio, a pool, topped off by sweeping views of the picturesque harbour and city skyline. The home is expected to fetch somewhere around the $9 million to $10 million range.
Bellevue Hill
In the world of Sydney real estate it’s all about location, and this $9 million-plus Bellevue Hill home certainly ticks that box Source: Supplied
With a tennis court, swimming pool and plenty of living space, it is the ultimate family retreat. Source: Supplied
With a winning trifecta of a tennis court, swimming pool and world-class location, this elegant family home ticks all the boxes when it comes to luxury living in Sydney. Set on a sprawling 1,900sq m block directly opposite leafy Woollahra Park and just moments from the shores of Rose Bay, this decadent three-storey home showcases everything there is to love about our city’s enviable lifestyle and is listed with a guide of $9 million-plus.
Whale Beach
With direct access to Whale Beach, this sprawling family home takes beachfront living to a whole other level. Source: Supplied
An inclinator will take you from the beach back up to the house where you can enjoy the ocean views. Source: Supplied
The very northern peninsular of Sydney’s northern beaches has long been the favoured holiday jaunt of the elite, offering plenty of spectacular homes with even more spectacular coastal views; and this Whale Beach Rd house is no exception. Set raised above the sandy shores but with direct access to the beach via an inclinator, this idyllic four-bedroom getaway could be yours for $6 million-plus.
Mosman
There’s no better place to view the pristine shores of Balmoral Beach than this vast Mosman home. Source: Supplied
Set high up on the headland, it includes plenty of space outside to entertain in front of the spectacular backdrop. Source: Supplied
Staring directly down across Balmoral Beach from the northern headland, this vast three-storey home is as inviting as it is luxurious. Stylish interiors are complemented by a soft colour palette that does perfectly to emphasise the striking expanses of blue that jump out at you almost everywhere you turn. This five-bedroom coastal gem at Stanton Rd is listed with a price guide of more than $6.5 million.
Warrawee
A combination of grand period charm and modern luxuries makes this Warrawee home one of the gems of the upper north shore. Source: Supplied
Contemporary additions include the striking landscaped gardens, tennis court and swimming pool. Source: Supplied
With its striking Tudor-style architecture and quiet, leafy setting, this sprawling estate could easily belong deep in England’s picturesque countryside. Looming gates at the front of the 1800sq m property hide it from street view, but beyond them, the scene is just magical as large trees frame the stately 1930s manor-style home. With five bedrooms, three bathrooms and a full size tennis court and swimming pool; this Pibrac Ave home is expected to fetch more than $5 million.
Originally published as Sydney’s most beautiful houses for sale
